examples.sentence: Receiving: もらう/いただく - Getting from others
Favor: くれる/くださる - Others giving to you
Direction of Actions - Perspective in giving
てあげる/てくれる/てもらう - Doing favors

sections.heading: Overview of Giving Verbs
sections.content:
Japanese has three main verbs for "giving," chosen based on the recipient's social status:

| Verb | Level | Used When | | ---------- | ------------- | -------------------------------- | | あげる | Neutral | Giving to equals/juniors | | やる | Casual/Humble | Giving to juniors/plants/animals | | さしあげる | Honorific | Giving to superiors |

友達にプレゼントをあげた "I gave a present to my friend" 先生に本をさしあげました "I gave a book to my teacher"

children.heading: Basic Pattern
children.content:
Giver + は + Recipient + に + Object + を + あげる

私は友達にプレゼントをあげた "I gave a present to my friend" 姉が弟にお金をあげました "My older sister gave money to my younger brother" 彼女に花をあげるつもりです "I plan to give her flowers"

children.heading: When to Use あげる
children.content:
1. You give to friends/equals

友達にCDをあげた "I gave a CD to my friend"

2. Family members give to each other (equals)

妹にバッグをあげました "I gave a bag to my younger sister"

3. Giving to juniors/younger people

後輩に本をあげた "I gave a book to my junior"

4. Third person gives to another third person

田中さんは山田さんに時計をあげた "Tanaka gave a watch to Yamada"

children.heading: When to Use やる
children.content:
1. Giving to plants

花に水をやる "Water the flowers" (give water to flowers) 植物に肥料をやった "I gave fertilizer to the plants"

2. Giving to animals

犬にえさをやる "Feed the dog" (give food to dog) 猫にミルクをやった "I gave milk to the cat"

3. Very casual speech to close juniors (rough/masculine)

弟に小遣いをやった "I gave pocket money to my brother" (casual/rough) Note: Can sound condescending. あげる is safer!

4. Humble expression in formal situations

お手伝いしてやりましょう "Let me help you" (humble)

children.heading: When to Use さしあげる
children.content:
1. Giving to superiors

先生にお土産をさしあげました "I gave a souvenir to my teacher" 社長にレポートをさしあげます "I'll give the report to the president"

2. Giving to customers/clients

お客様に資料をさしあげます "I'll give materials to the customer"

3. Showing respect

おばあさんにプレゼントをさしあげた "I gave a present to my grandmother"

children.heading: に - Recipient Marker
children.content: 友達に本をあげた "I gave a book to my friend" 先生にお土産をさしあげました "I gave a souvenir to my teacher"

children.heading: を - Object Marker
children.content: 彼にプレゼントをあげた "I gave him a present"

children.heading: When talking about others giving:
children.content: 田中さんは山田さんに本をあげた "Tanaka gave a book to Yamada" 先生は学生に賞をさしあげた "The teacher gave an award to the student" 兄が友達にゲームをやった "My brother gave a game to his friend" (casual)

children.heading: Past Tense
children.content: あげた - gave (neutral) やった - gave (casual) さしあげた - gave (honorific)

children.heading: Negative
children.content: あげない - won't give やらない - won't give さしあげない - won't give

children.heading: Te-form (doing for someone)
children.content: 手伝ってあげる "I'll help you" (do the favor of helping) 教えてあげた "I taught (them)" 作ってさしあげます "I'll make it (for you)" (honorific)

children.heading: Pattern: Verb-て + あげる/やる/さしあげる
children.content:
This means "do something FOR someone":

友達を手伝ってあげた "I helped my friend" 妹に本を読んであげる "I'll read a book to my younger sister" 先生に説明してさしあげました "I explained to the teacher"

children.heading: Example 1: Birthday Gift
children.content: A: 誕生日に何をあげましたか？ "What did you give for their birthday?" B: 本をあげました "I gave a book" A: 喜んでくれましたか？ "Were they happy?" B: はい、とても喜んでくれました "Yes, very happy"

children.heading: Example 2: To a Teacher
children.content: A: 先生に何をさしあげますか？ "What will you give to the teacher?" B: お花をさしあげようと思います "I'm thinking of giving flowers" A: いいですね "That's nice"

children.heading: Example 3: Helping a Friend
children.content: A: 手伝ってあげようか？ "Shall I help you?" B: ありがとう！助かります "Thanks! That helps"

children.heading: Casual
children.content: あげる やる (very casual)

children.heading: Polite
children.content: あげます やります

children.heading: Honorific
children.content: さしあげる さしあげます

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using やる for people (sounds rude)
children.content: Wrong: 友達にやった ❌ (sounds condescending) Right: 友達にあげた ✓ "I gave to my friend"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using あげる to superiors
children.content: Unnatural: 先生に本をあげました ⚠️ Better: 先生に本をさしあげました ✓ "I gave a book to my teacher"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong particle
children.content: Wrong: 友達をプレゼントをあげた ❌ Right: 友達にプレゼントをあげた ✓ "I gave a present to my friend"

children.heading: Mistake 4: Using when you're the receiver
children.content: Wrong: 私は友達にプレゼントをあげられた ❌ Right: 私は友達にプレゼントをもらった ✓ "I received a present from my friend"

sections.heading: Comparison Chart
sections.content: | Recipient | Verb | Example | | -------------- | ----------- | ---------------- | | Equal/Friend | あげる | 友達にあげた | | Junior/Younger | あげる/やる | 弟にあげた | | Superior | さしあげる | 先生にさしあげた | | Plant | やる | 花に水をやる | | Animal | やる | 犬にえさをやる |

children.heading: 〜てあげる (offer to do something)
children.content:
手伝ってあげようか？ "Shall I help you?" 教えてあげる "I'll teach you" 作ってあげるよ "I'll make it for you"

Warning: Can sound condescending if overused!

children.heading: Present for future giving
children.content: プレゼントをあげるつもりです "I intend to give a present" 明日あげます "I'll give it tomorrow"

children.heading: Within family
children.content: To younger siblings: あげる or やる To older siblings: あげる To parents: さしあげる (very polite) or あげる

children.heading: At work
children.content: To colleagues (equal): あげる To boss/seniors: さしあげる To juniors: あげる

children.heading: To strangers
children.content: Use あげる (neutral and safe) Use さしあげる if they're clearly older/higher status

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 友達にCDをあげました "I gave a CD to my friend" 花に水をやります "I water the flowers" 先生に手紙をさしあげた "I gave a letter to my teacher"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 誕生日に妹にネックレスをあげるつもりです "I plan to give my sister a necklace for her birthday" 毎日犬にえさをやっています "I feed my dog every day" 部長にレポートをさしあげなければなりません "I must give the report to the department head"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: 友達が困っていたので、お金を貸してあげました "My friend was in trouble, so I lent them money" この資料をお客様にさしあげてください "Please give these materials to the customer" 彼は弟におもちゃを買ってやった "He bought a toy for his younger brother"
